Class YahooData

  • java.lang.Object
    • YahooData

  • public class YahooData
extends java.lang.Object
    This class retrieves historical prices and returns from yahoo.fr Data is available in different formats : prices, returns and log returns. A YahooData object is used to store data before creating portfolios.
    Since:
    2015-04-26
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Thomas Doutre

      • constructURL

        private static java.lang.String constructURL(java.lang.String tickerSymbol)
        This method is used to construct the URL to retrieve data from. We want to get the maximum amount of data. Example : constructURL("AAPL") will give the URL with historical data of Apple.
        Parameters:
        tickerSymbol - This is the ticker.
        Returns:
        String This returns the URL (String format).

      • minimumTimeInterval

        private static int minimumTimeInterval(java.util.ArrayList<double[]> arrayList)
        This method is used to get the minimum length of all the double[] in a ArrayList in order not to construct portfolios with unavailable data.
        Parameters:
        arrayList - This is the arrayList.
        Returns:
        int This returns the minimum length.

      • getLinesNumber

        private static int getLinesNumber(java.net.URL url)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        This method returns the number of lines in a text file from an URL. This method is important to deal with double[][] instead of custom objects.
        Parameters:
        url - This is the URL.
        Returns:
        int This is the number of lines in the text file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getPricesFromYahoo

        private void getPricesFromYahoo(java.lang.String[] symbols)
        This method stores the historical prices in a double[][] matrix. Columns represents differents tickers. Lines represents trading days. The resulting matrix may not include all data available, because we only include data that is relevant for creating a portfolio.
        Parameters:
        symbols - This is an array of String, with all the tickers. Historical prices of these tickers will be in the resulting matrix.

      • getReturnsFromYahoo

        private void getReturnsFromYahoo(java.lang.String[] symbols)
        This method stores the historical returns in a double[][] matrix. Columns represents differents tickers. Lines represents trading days. The resulting matrix may not include all data available, because we only include data that is relevant for creating a portfolio.
        Parameters:
        symbols - This is an array of String, with all the tickers. Historical returns of these tickers will be in the resulting matrix.

      • getlogReturnsMatrixFromYahoo

        private void getlogReturnsMatrixFromYahoo(java.lang.String[] symbols)
        This method stores the historical log returns in a double[][] matrix. Columns represents differents tickers. Lines represents trading days. The resulting matrix may not include all data available, because we only include data that is relevant for creating a portfolio.
        Parameters:
        symbols - This is an array of String, with all the tickers. Historical log returns of these tickers will be in the resulting matrix.
